result.execSummary:
The defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/15/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-36
*PROBATION REVIEW hearing March 18, 2916 at 1:30 p.m in BR. 36.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- No Contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

timeConds.notes:
The first 20 days are to be served NOW, the remaining 25 days is STAYED pending review.
**1/15/2016  STAY LIFTED as to three (3) days.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.
**03-18-16/PRH, defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to serve 10 days in HOC; STRAIGHT TIME, with No Good Time Credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Court did not a set a review hearing.  Agent to contact the court if a review is needed.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 03/18/2016 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction with credit for 7 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 14 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; the first 20 days are to be served now, the remaining 25 days is STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Alexis M. or her residence.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.
  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

Received and filed:
Justice Point Report.
cab
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any cash bail on deposit forfeited.  The Court ordered a Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Test. Discussion regarding bail. Court admonished defendant.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Defendant requests an adjournment or Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALEXIS M.  OR HER RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Keontay Lamon Durrah in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
